text: today I'm making sticky ribs you start
by making the sticky glaze and it's a
combination of fresh ginger you need 1
inch piece that's been peeled and then
just smash it a little bit to release
some of the flavors you'll smash with
the side of your knife and then it can
go right into a 9 by 13 inch baking dish
with 3/4 of a cup of brown sugar one
jalapeno or Serrano chili sliced
lengthwise and go right into the dish
quarter cup of fish sauce 2 tablespoons
of soy sauce in here as well then you
also need a quarter cup of lemon juice
wow these lemons have tons of seeds so
crazy whisk your sticky glaze or
soon-to-be sticky glaze together and
then you can add two pounds of spare
ribs that have been cut into pieces
turn to coat and then these need to cook
I find that the ribs cook really well if
they're covered first so cover with some
aluminum foil have your oven preheating
to 350 for one hour and then uncover and
bake for another 40 minutes or until
they're nice and tender and fully glazed
see this meat a little bit it's going to
my mouth right now
mmm oh my god I stick the deliciousness
guys are not gonna believe this salty
tangy goodness
